intro: Veronica senanensis, commonly known as the Senanense speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. It has lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, and its stems are often sprawling or upright depending on the growing conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
